summary.text:
**Clarifying JSON requirements**

I need to produce a JSON object with specific fields: summary_md, one_line_summary, highlights (an array of 3–7 items), and next_questions (1–3 questions). However, the developer instructions mention including citations to relied-on files, while the response format doesn't have a specific "citations" field. It seems I can integrate citations within the summary_md or highlights. But I must adhere strictly to the JSON schema, ensuring no extra keys are added.

**Constructing the summary**

I can't add custom keys, so I'll include citations in the summary_md, maybe at the end under "Citations: ...". I also need to keep the "one_line_summary" within 100 characters, and "summary_md" to a max of 200 words. The highlights will be strings in an array. In summarizing, I’ll consolidate key facts verified from the research notes, like the classification of maximal cliques and outerplanar cases. I must include proved lemmas, propositions, and open problems. I’ll craft a concise summary now.

**Planning citation and highlights**

I need to include citations for files such as "Research Notes" or "Verifier Summary." The developer's instructions noted that we should cite specific materials. From the user's message, I can cite "Research Notes," "Verifier Summary," and "Rigorous Proofs." I should mention up to three citations. 

For highlights, I’ll choose 6 core bullets summarizing key facts and verified k-null families. These will include statements like G being K4-free, the connection between maximal cliques and facial triangles, and other essential points. Let's craft those bullets succinctly!

**Formulating the summary and citations**

I need to include 1 to 3 citations from the files I relied on, even though the schema doesn't specify a citations field. I can incorporate them into the summary_md, like "Citations: Research Notes; Rigorous Proofs; Verifier Summary." The summary needs to stay under 200 words, so I’ll aim for around 120 words. For the one_line_summary, I want to keep it under 100 characters, focusing on verified structural lemmas and open problems. I'll ensure the JSON format includes highlights and next questions, keeping everything concise.

content.text: {"summary_md":"This round established core structural lemmas for finite Whitney triangulations of the disk and proved several small k-null cases. Main verified facts: G is K4-free, so maximal cliques of the primal are exactly the facial triangles; the link of any interior vertex is a chordless cycle, forcing interior degree ≥4; for an interior vertex v the incident-face set T(v) is a maximal clique in kG; any interior face t with all three edges interior yields N(t) (t plus the three adjacent faces) which induces a maximal K4 in kG; and kG is connected when G has ≥2 faces. k-nullness was proved for fans (one interior vertex), the two-triangle disk, and the hexagon-with-central-triangle (k^2G ≅ K1). Remaining major gaps are a full classification of maximal cliques of kG (conjecture: every non-star maximal clique is some N(t)) and a completed ear-removal induction for the outerplanar case. Citations: Research Notes; Rigorous Proofs; Verifier Summary.","one_line_summary":"Structural lemmas proved; some small disk triangulations are k-null; clique-classification and outerplanar proof remain.","highlights":["G is K4-free ⇒ maximal cliques of G are exactly facial triangles.","The link of any interior vertex is a chordless cycle, so interior vertices have degree ≥4.","For interior v, T(v) (faces incident to v) is a maximal clique in kG.","For an interior face t with all three edges interior, N(t) (t plus its three adjacent faces) induces a maximal K4 in kG.","kG is connected whenever G has at least two faces.","Verified k-null families: fans (one interior vertex), two-triangle disk, and hexagon with central triangle (k^2G ≅ K1)."],"next_questions":["Prove every non-star maximal clique of kG has size ≤4 and equals N(t) for some interior face t (rigorous classification).","Complete the outerplanar (no interior vertices) case via ear-removal induction: show k^2G is acyclic/has a suitable monotone invariant to deduce k-nullness.","Exhaustively enumerate small disk Whitney triangulations (esp. interior degrees 4–5) to search for counterexamples or supporting data."]}

one_line_summary.description: Brief one-line summary for UI display
one_line_summary.title: One Line Summary
